title: Wes Nelson lays into Love Island as he admits he's ashamed of reality star roots
text:
Get the biggest Daily Love Island stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Celebrity X Factor's Wes Nelson has launched a scathing attack on Love Island.

The reality star was catapulted into the limelight after starring on Love Island in 2017 and he found love with his now-ex Megan Barton Hanson .

But Wes revealed he was ashamed of his reality star beginnings as he said he hates the name "The Islanders" given to his Celebrity X Factor band.

The TV personality reunites with Zara McDermott , Eyal Booker and Samira Mighty to perform on Celebrity X Factor.

However, the ripped hunk laid into the show that made him famous as he said the band name "The Islanders" makes him look like a "f*****g idiot".

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

Wes made it clear he wanted to be rid of the connotations which come with the show.

He told Heat magazine : "It's a touchy subject. I'm not saying 'The Islanders'. I'll look like a f*****g idiot."

The Dancing on Ice star insisted he wanted to be known for something more than who he is dating, despite going into Love Island to find a long-lasting romance two years ago.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: wesnelson/Instagram)

He added: "I'm not a diva! I still don't consider myself a celebrity, I hate saying that word. We just want to be known for something other than dating."

Wes continued his campaign as he made another thinly-veiled dig at the show that made him famous.

The hunk said Celebrity X Factor would give him and the islanders would be able to showcase what they "really love and care about".

He said: "There’s so much more to us, all of us have that mutual love and passion for singing, and people don’t know that.

"So this is going to be good, to be able to showcase what we really love and care about."
description: Wes was catapulted into the limelight after starring on Love Island in 2017 but now two years later he doesn't want to be associated with it
